values.text: Welcome, how can I assist you?

concat.scalar: **Punjabi University** is a collegiate state public university located in [Patiala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patiala), [Punjab](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punjab,_India), [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India). It was established on 30 April 1962 and is only the second [university](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University) in the world to be named after a language,

after [Hebrew University](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebrew_University) of [Israel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel). Originally it was conceived as a unitary multi-faculty teaching and research university, primarily meant for the development and enrichment of the [Punjabi language](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punjabi_language) and culture, but alive to the [social](https://en.

wikipedia.org/wiki/Social) and education requirements of the state.

**Do you want to know about its departments?**
I'm sorry, I did not catch that, please restate your response.

The prominent university departments are:[[18]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punjabi_University#cite_note-18)


  - University College of Engineering (CSE/ECE/ME/CE)
  - Department of Computer Science
  - Punjabi Department
  - Linguistics Department
  - School of Management Studies
  - Economics
  - Mathematics
  - Department of Physiotherapy
  - Department of Biotechnology
  -

Department of Pharmaceutical Sciences & Drug Research
  - S.Daljit Singh Sethi[[19]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punjabi_University#cite_note-19) Physics Department
  - Department of Education and Community services
  - Department of Botany

**Do you want to proceed further?**
I'm sorry, I did not catch that, please restate your response.

Students are encouraged to take active part in sports. Facilities for games such as [hockey](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Field_hockey), [football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football), [cricket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cricket), [basketball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basketball), [volleyball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volleyball), [athletics](https://en.wikipedia.

org/wiki/Sport_of_athletics), etc. and well as indoor games are provided. The Punjabi University has a large gymnasium and a hall for indoor games. It is one of the very few institutions in India to possess its own [velodrome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Velodrome).

The university has been awarded [Maulana Abul Kalam Azad (MAKA) Trophy](https://en.wikipedia.

org/wiki/Maulana_Abul_Kalam_Azad_Trophy) nine times, the latest being in the year 2016–2017. MAKA Trophy represents the highest award given for inter-university sports and university sportsperson performance in international and national arena by the [Government of India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_of_India)

**Do you want to know about hostels?**
I'm sorry, I did not catch that, please restate your response.

There are three residential hostels for boys and four residential hostels for girls. The hostels house 4000 students. In addition to this, separate boys and girls hostel for engineering college have started functioning.
I'm sorry, I did not catch that, please restate your response.

### Regional centres and Neighborhood campuses
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Punjabi_University&action=edit&section=3)]

The university has four regional centres: the Guru Kashi Regional Center at [Bathinda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bathinda), [Guru Kashi Campus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punjabi_University_Guru_Kashi_Campus) at [Talwandi Sabo](https://en.wikipedia.

org/wiki/Talwandi_Sabo), Regional Centre for [Information Technology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_Technology) and [Management](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Management) at [Mohali](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mohali), Nawab Sher Mohammad Khan Institute of Advanced Studies in [Urdu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urdu), [Persian](https://en.wikipedia.

org/wiki/Persian_language) and [Arabic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabic_language) at [Malerkotla](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malerkotla).[[6]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punjabi_University#cite_note-6) Punjabi University also maintains seven neighborhood campuses at [Rampura Phul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rampura_Phul), [Jhunir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jhunir),

[Sardulgarh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sardulgarh), [Ralla](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralla,_Punjab), [Maur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maur_Mandi), [Jaito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jaito) and Dehla Seehan.[[7]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punjabi_University#cite_note-7)

### Constituent colleges
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.

php?title=Punjabi_University&action=edit&section=4)]

The university has also established 13 constituent colleges[[8]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Punjabi_University#cite_note-8) at [Mansa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mansa,_Punjab), [Rampura Phul](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rampura_Phul), [Sardulgarh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sardulgarh), [Ghudda](https://en.wikipedia.

org/wiki/Ghudda), Bahadurpur (Mansa), [Barnala](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barnala), Benra (Dhuri),Chuni Kalan, Dhilwan, [Ghanaur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ghanaur), [Jaito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jaito), Meera Pur and [Moonak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moonak).

**conversation ends here**
